Классика... Отличная игра, чтобы вечерком почиллить, проходится очень быстро. Хороший сюжет, необычный геймплей, есть атмосфера, которая мне напомнила игру для ps2 Wall-e. Понравилось, что в некоторых местах можно использовать нестандартные решения. Вообщем, эта игра нечто большее, чем просто дополнение к HL2. Ой, только посмотри на это, нет не на это это, а на вон то это!

Отличная головоломка, которую порой без подсматривания в прохождения пройти будет довольно проблематично. Жаль, что игра короткая и проходится даже при неспешном прохождении менее чем за 3 часа. Но не смотря на это в неё стоит поиграть.
Игра хоть и короткая, а временами ещё и довольно сложная, но она способна не только привлечь внимание, но и затянуть. После прохождения игру периодически захочется перепроходить снова и снова.

Хорошая приключенческая головоломка от первого лица. Сюжет разворачивается в научной лаборатории. Суть игрового процесса лежит в последовательном преодолении препятствий при помощи портальной пушки. Геймплей устроен так, что в процессе прохождения механики решения проблем будут усложняться дополнительными особенностями, например, движущимися платформами, силовыми полями и так далее

After all these years, this is still a masterpiece worth playing, if only to get an idea of what Valve could put out in their prime. This is an inventive puzzle game using a portal device that allows you to create portals by shooting at surfaces in order to solve various puzzles and avoid hazards. And for the first few levels, it seems like Portal is just a nice little puzzle game but the game takes a dark turn when the antagonist, GLaDOS, decides to terminate the player, thus turning the series of tests into an attempt to escape Aperture Labs. It's a simple change in tone that is still very effective.

And what can be said about GLaDOS that hasn't been said already? She is THE villain that defined a decade and is now remembered as one of the best video game villains of all time, in no small part thanks to Ellen McLain's vocal performance, which, coupled with Valve's excellent writing, made GLaDOS such an unforgettable nemesis. She is the driving force that pushes the player to go through all those test chambers to a final showdown against the mad AI. Admittedly, the final battle is a bit on the easy side but it's still a climactic end which saw GLaDOS losing her mind with every core the player destroys and ends in an explosive finale that leaves the player wanting for more. And when you thought you were finally free from the Aperture Labs, seeing the blue sky and the remains of GLaDOS on Aperture's parking lot, Valve pulls you back with a sequel. Portal 2 is the superior game of the two but the first game is still a fine piece of gaming software that everyone should play, if only to understand how important Valve and this game were to gaming as a whole.

This was a triumph.
I'm making a note here:
HUGE SUCCESS.
It's hard to overstate
My satisfaction.
Aperture Science
We do what we must
Because we can.
For the good of all of us.
Except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying
Over every mistake.
You just keep on trying
Till you run out of cake.
And the Science gets done.
And you make a neat gun.
For the people who are
Still alive.

I'm not even angry.
I'm being so sincere right now.
Even though you broke my heart.
And killed me.
And tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because
I was so happy for you!
Now these points of data
Make a beautiful line.
And we're out of beta.
We're releasing on time.
So I'm GLaD. I got burned.
Think of all the things we learned
For the people who are
Still alive.

Go ahead and leave me.
I think I prefer to stay inside.
Maybe you'll find someone else
To help you.
Maybe Black Mesa...
THAT WAS A JOKE, HA HA, FAT CHANCE.
Anyway this cake is great
It's so delicious and moist
Look at me still talking when there's Science to do
When I look out there
It makes me GLaD I'm not you
I've experiments to run
There is research to be done
On the people who are
Still alive.

And believe me I am still alive
I'm doing science and I'm still alive
I feel FANTASTIC and I'm still alive
While you're dying I'll be still alive
And when you're dead I will be still alive
Still alive
Still alive.

It's the original Portal.  If you have no soul, you will STILL find some enjoyment out of this masterpiece of the technology at the time, wrote a simple yet surprisingly strong character development, and also, it was made by a couple kids in their basement and now they are millionaire's.  Why?  Because Valve has a (Not flawless but close) eye for innovation and shockingly beautiful stories.
